CJtuFkcHSKk_ibB0W663MQ.text: Whenever I find myself in Camden I seem to end up here. It's a very large, busy bar but the drinks are reasonably priced (especially if you drink wine by the bottle) and the atmosphere is good. It's clean and tidy, as you would expect from a Wetherspoons pub. Nothing really stands out about it but it's a good place to stop for drink during the day when out shopping and a great place to start the evening if you're going on to a local club or something later on. I've stumbled out of this place more times that I care to remember. What I especially like about this bar is that it caters for all, whether you have waist length plastic hair or a short back and sides.

4mofnyT1vJXHegEbWOso3g.text: This place is so quaint it sits on the Camdne Lock, you would think you were in the heart of the countryside. The drinks are cheaper, with lots of special offers, the food is delicious my fav is fish and chips or try the hot chicken tikka mazala curry, gorgeous.

d4uZ1gPGHSXJOhyFr9MAag.text: Serves a purpose to get cheap drinks, dance to some cheese and get shit faced. Crowd is a strange mix of all sorts from Chav, Camden hipsters, rockers and lost looking tourists. I quite enjoy people watching in here for some strange interactions and the inevitable fight. Oh and you need ID to get in even if you're clearly over 21 and the bouncers are complete and utter arseholes.

IsN7SvgCgEg-T9sYG2Jy4Q.text: This bar just...creeps me out a bit. Yes, it has free wi-fi. Yes, the drinks are cheap. I think it's just the clientele, mainly old biker men and still-drunk camdenites, that doesn't sit well with me.It's a spacious bar, my friend enjoys their food (their soup, at least) but absolutely nothing about this bar stands out to me, especially when there are so many more unique bars in Camden. I suppose if one is a tourist and wants a commercial pub, then you'll love it. Myself....not so much.

XUfkdqe_mV-jeP65JU1oaQ.text: The tables near the windows are lovely between the hours of 2pm and 8pm. After that, people inexplicably line up to get in here. It's a great (read: cheap) place near work to go for drinks with colleagues, but I would never go out of my way to be here. The crowd is...interesting. It seems very touristy, maybe, or like somebody tricked these people into going out in Camden and they needed to keep their destination as un-Camden as possible. In an area with good music and interesting things going on, this place just bleeds dull. But, again, the drinks are cheap, so bottoms up!

hKtPnWhfKefbJ_Nq_hvZ8g.text: Possibly the best setting in Central London for a summer cocktail, Lloyd's Bar in Camden Town has an amazing outdoor area where you could even dip your toes into the water. Set right next to the Camden Lock, you can catch the actual lock in operation as boats pass through. The interior is quite large and has a very pub-like feel, though on the weekends the music takes over and people have been known to throw down a groove or two.The best part about Llloyd's Bar is the fact that it's a small pool of normalcy in a part of London usually commended for its weirdness. You're guaranteed okay bar service, good food and drinks at the right price. Go during summer after a Camden Market shopping spree and you'll have made a great decision. This pub is also perfect for the family outing with a menu that caters to the kiddies as well.

photos.caption: Photo of The Ice Wharf - London, United Kingdom. The Ice Wharf

NLIu9WUMdBXUzGGIbhrYvQ.text: Best Whetherspoons in town, if you sit outside by the canal and its not a Saturday night you might even forget your at a whetherspoons while still drinking your 9.99 bottle of wine

rOLXxxeF-oLhPC_Y7QF78g.text: I don't mind Wetherspoos in general, they are good value for money and this one is spacious, nay cavernous, inside. Considering the location I'm surprised but glad that they've not tried to cram more tables in. Service is fast and friendly BUT..We ordered an all day brunch and a superfood salad and neither came as described. The brunch was missing hash browns, but the superfood salad was worse as it went from being good value to being a bunch of leave for a £5er because there was not butternut squash, no seeds, and very little brocolli or beans, so essentially some spinach and lettuce.

jP0IpQV_JY6xZFvErcbiog.text: The Ice Wharf is a nice bar. Its location is cool, right next to the lock so you can take in the calmness that being by water brings, but it is still quite busy and has a lively atmosphere. Space is not an issue, the place is quite large and on my visits my friends and I have had no problems finding a table. In fact we quite enjoyed the booth style seats which were against the wall as it felt like we had a degree of privacy.Being a Weatherspoons however, The Ice Wharf lacks character. It is like a clone of so many of their other establishments around town and doesn't make the most of the Camden vibe. Compared to other places in Camden, it just feels a little bland. On the plus side, it does mean that you know what you are going to get and provides assurances about decent quality food and cheap drinks.Its location also makes it an ideal spot for either taking a break from shopping in Camden Market or as a meeting spot for gig go-ers at the Roundhouse up the road.

photos.caption: Photo of The Ice Wharf - London, United Kingdom

Gl-bn-emWuxxaVq1N-vsdw.text: Well, it usually smells strongly of vomit in here and the clientele are all pretty disturbing ... But the drinks are cheap!

-V2E8GAfPUhpHHL3HVZ6rA.text: The Ice Wharf Sits right next to Camden Lock, is this huge bar, and open throughout the day, serving great food and real ale. On Sunday afternoon, or any afternoon, I have often gone to Camden town with the girlfriend. I have said on a few occasions, that shopping really isn't my thing unless I'm shopping for food, so the ice wharf is where I reside and wait for her to finish, have a drink, or even a burger.On a sunny day it is perfect, as there is plenty of outdoor seating facing the canal. You can sit and watch the odd canal boat go by, and watch the people of Camden walking across the bridge. On top of that, they have real Ale!!I know that the Ice Wharf is open till late, I have only ever been there to have a few drink with a few friends first and then head out to wherever we are going. I wouldn't really imagine spending the night there, but I know people do. Due to its size and prices, I can fully understand why people do.I myself see it as a day venue, they serve a great platter with potato wedges, onion rings and all the rest, and it can easily fill two people.

photos.caption: Photo of The Ice Wharf - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Ice Wharf - London, United Kingdom

2NUhjyS-NXlaIkz17xuP_Q.text: A Lloyds Bar is a Lloyds bar is a Lloyds bar right? Well, no actually, this one is the best I've come across. This is the Lloyd Grossman of the chain.The big brother of the Wetherspoons group, this has the same feel. Boasting a wide and cheapish range of drinks and large snack/meal menu, this place is huge and it's decked out all modern so it actually makes for a nice place to hang out in. If the weather is good then you ought to sit outside on the tables or, as we did, stand on the canalside watching the barges 'zoom' by. Soak up some of that Camden vibe!We got ourselves nice and merry here ahead of the Camden Crawl - cheap drinks, sunny weather and chatting to friends by the water. Thanks life!

gMOyaocus-yrBEwWnL0pQw.text: During the week this is an excellent Wetherspoons Lloyds bar in Camden, worth a visit for the cheap high quality ale on offer even if the weather isn't suitable to take advantage of the outside tables by the canal. There is a younger and less 'eccentric' crowd than many pubs in this chain tend to attract. But the pub has a dark side. Every full moonI meanweekend it is taken over by an unfriendly and aggressive group of bouncers who make getting in and out of the pub a dangerous experience. I was lucky enough to be merely pushed to one side because I was stood in the way of one of them and something.probably his next fight. (I actually only saw them punch one personbut then I was staying out of their way after I realized what a menace they were). I couldn't believe quite how unpleasant they were so I checked around on the internet and it seems a lot of people have taken issue with it. If you don't wish to incur their wrath, take off your hats and wait patiently to get in boys and girlsand you might be lucky. Or you could decide that you want a fun night out without a side order of flexing arrogance. I really want to give it a 1 star for being so blind to the gang of thugs they have hired for the door.but during the week this is a nice place to come and the staff behind the bar were very friendly..so begrudgingly I give it 2 stars. I will never ever come here again on a weekend. That much is certain.

AyJBKpZzoJZKq2U5M-iMsA.text: Good as a bar but not a club so whoever wants to go there, make sure you get out before 9 as there are long queues to get one drink and not much staff to handle the crowd...

4AHLd5BN_QS3h0YiZ1HazQ.text: this place had super cheap drinks which is what attracted us to it - but we went towards midnight on a Saturday and the bar was full of creepy guys. as a young woman studying abroad I was horrified at the group of men that were allowed into the bar... I kept getting stalked and groped while navigating the dance floor or heading to the ladies room... I would not go back based on this experience.

7yJ3J4g9Eu7tQP_OGMBgJQ.text: I am a big fan of the Lloyds bar chain. The booze is cheap, the food is cheap and with this one you also get a fantastic location on the lock. In the summer eating outside is great as you can really sample the vibe of Camden at your leisure.The bar is stocked to the rafters with offers, such as double shots for the price of singles, and cheap promotions on certain bottles and draught.It gets really busy and tables can be hard to come by even with the venue being so large.As Lloyds go, you know what you are getting and their standard rarely slips. Just don't expect Michelin standards and you won't be disappointed. You can get a good hearty meal, a beer and a chaser for less than £10. That sounds like a good deal to me. In the daytime it is open to kids with a good menu just for them. In the evenings it livens up with louder music and a good time vibe.

LFkNy-5pGI21hq--z1Devg.text: We were fighting the elements last Saturday in Camden Town but quickly warmed up when we found The Ice Wharf in Camden Town. Situated just by Camden Lock, just as you walk over that little bridge by the canal. I was amazed to find it quite spacious inside, I expected the pub to be a lot smaller. I really love the seating plan, you have your own space but still feel part of the cozy atmosphere. The prices were still competitive regardless of how many tourists flock to the area. We did not have lunch there as we were stuffed by indulging in some of the treats from the markets but we did have a few coffee's which were great. Should have stayed and made an evening of it but had to travel a long way back home.

2r_nSKrWyPYZg9MCZmy-Lg.text: I just can't decide about this place I came in once and had a fantastic night, quick service, great atmosphere, and let's face it cool people everywhere. Then I came in last night and saw it was 1. Massively understaffed behind the bar, with really really bad service (Waited 30mins for my drinks)2. Poor staff, the man to my left waved for attention, and when asking for his drinks was actually slapped by the (male) bartender. 3. They close the outside area really really early, despite the amazing weather, so inside it's absolutely boiling. I'd recommend going with friends on the non mobbed nights, but friday saturday you can do better

J5mVvb0sTE25r3HbpyTlVA.text: Good! Still a 'spoons, but a great location and a good layout with lots of space and well connected to other places!

tj98FOz9pBCQWskPideLvQ.text: My brother took me here forgetting that it was the weekend and that we couldn't take advantage of their cheap weeknight deals, but we still had a good lunch. The food and drinks were still pretty cheap compared to other places I had been, and we got to sit and people watch all the people walking around Camden. I had a super delicious BBQ chicken sandwich. And no one was there so service was really quick. Overall a nice place to pop in and grab a bite after a morning full of shopping.

PSHfnm8XsMv-ZvHeaYXLnQ.text: I really didn't think much of this place at first, but the wine is cheap (and decent enough), the staff were really friendly, there's outdoor seating by the canal and is REALLY big, so even when it's crowded it doesn't really FEEL crowded. So yeah, the Ice Wharf is definitely A-OK!

qfNB90b1xzR8CTFFHSnR1A.text: This is a big ol' Wetherspoons right on the Camden lock. I had cycled by here on my way down the canal manys the time before I finally stopped in. I was meeting an old friend for a drink, and we settled on the Ice Wharf for its location, and the fact it was the nearest bar we could see that was catching the summer sun. Anyway, my friend had an obsession with a particular brand of organic cider that he swore made you giggle when you drank it. Knowing it was a Wetherspoons, I thought the closest we'd get to it would be fizzy, sickly Magners, but lo and behold, they actually did stock it. Unsurprisingly, my friend was right, and after a few bottles sitting in the sun, we were giggling away like schoolgirls. I can't say much else for the atmosphere or service at the place as we only sat outside and drank this one drink. But it was a great afternoon, and I would definitely drop by again on a similarly sunny day.

jMuLjAXfed5qTZMUNv-vfQ.text: Super busy. Decent prices. Be ready. But 2 for 1 drink pitchers. But very busy. The patio is super crowded so you have to wait for a table. It's a first come first serve sitch.

w6bkKq4Jar8r5MHXQ0p9Lw.text: Cheep and cheerful. Its little on the grimy side but as long as you r aware of that prior then no complaints. I've always used this place to meet up with friends when in the area. Always have offers on alcohol and curry and steak night is always ok.

photos.caption: Photo of The Ice Wharf - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Ice Wharf - London, United Kingdom

JNPoJA_OAylM_vQpzw5bsA.text: Formally a Lloyd's No 1 Bar, the Ice Wharf is part of the Wetherspoon pub chain.I'm not a great fan of Wetherspoon's usually as I find that they are normally on the dark side in their decor, with little daylight. You can't argue with the prices though. The reason I have given this particular branch 4 stars is because of it's setting. The pub is in the heart of Camden, right on the lock, overlooking the canal on the opposite side of the Camden Lock Market. There is quite a large outside seating area, with great views of the lock. Watching the barges manoeuvre through weeping willow trees on a nice sunny day, is something I never tire of enjoying.The pub itself is huge with a long bar, lots of tables and booths, plus an elevated seating area. Like the other Wetherspoon pubs, there are no stools at the bar. I'm sure this is to make sure the area is clear to just encourage the area to be used for serving purposes. Shame as standing/sitting at the bar in a pub is something I usually like to do when I'm enjoying a pint.I usually come here on a Monday morning, after I've finished my weekly shop. What I really like is that they currently offer a bottomless mug of filter coffee for just 99p. You can have as many refills as you want up to 2pm. It's Lavazza coffee, so not too bad.This pub has the usual Wetherspoon traits, like no music, tv with no volume showing only news and theme nights such as curry club, mexican etc.I don't think that I would come here in the evening, as I think the prices encourage drinkers who our out on a mission to fill themselves up with cheap booze before moving on to somewhere else, and it does get rammed, especially at the weekend. For the moment I'm contenet with my 99p bottomless coffee, and probably the best view you can get in Camden. That alone is worth a 4 star status.

photos.caption: Photo of The Ice Wharf - London, United Kingdom. Love this spot.
Photo of The Ice Wharf - London, United Kingdom. All this for 99p.
Photo of The Ice Wharf - London, United Kingdom

wnAjeJjsTWGFNHHdcd8coQ.text: Horrid service! Rude waitress with a draconian demeanor pacing the outside seating, which had tons of seating, demanding no one sit there who wasn't dining. My mother had the chicken, I went next door had the sushi and was going to seat next to her. Literally a handful of diners outside and this troll forced us to leave. The sushi place gladly let us sit and eat.Paying customers shouldn't be treated this way. Especially tourist, in a heavy tourist area. Also the food was bland and clearly just heated breaded chicken out of a freezer bag.I highly recommend that if you're on holiday steer clear of this painfully rude establishment!

wPbEjKV_dkdnaNrP1o9dBg.text: Came here on a Saturday afternoon/early evening for drinks, and it was so much fun!  Drinks were well priced... I can't imagine how good of a deal it must be during happy hour!!  It was pretty much self-serve, though someone was cleaning up after the tables.  It took a while for them to clear our table, but we had to grab it once we saw people leaving because then we would be joining the crowd comfortably standing in front of the bar.  The next person waiting on tables was much more attentive and even offered to take our orders so maybe floor seating is meant to be service, or at least for food.  We didn't mind grabbing drinks from the bar since it was quick anyway.  There were a ton of people inside and outside the pub, but the noise level was still perfect.  It made for a great atmosphere with great drinks, accompanied by awesome company.

dkLUvo4D4A_kkIBltnOUSQ.text: Located on Camden Lock, this place is easy to miss. I have been staying at the Holiday Inn for a few months now and never realised this Wetherspoons was here. It was a Tuesday night, so it was steak night. I ordered the 14oz Angus Steak and spoiled myself with a side of Peppercorn sauce and some onion rings. I also had a pint of Coors light. The whole thing came to a whooping £12. This is why I love Wetherspoons, when eating out in London i tend to find the prices are insanely high for some of the most common foods. The service in here was typical Wetherspoons. You come in, find a table, take a note of the table number, approach the bar, order and give your table number. The food arrived after about 15 mins, and was actually decent. My only criticism is that i love my steak blue. They refused to make it blue, so i settled for rare. To be honest this was no deal breaker for me. The food overall was pretty good for what i paid. I really felt that i got great value for money. The server at the bar was really friendly. The atmosphere was also a typical Wetherspoons, people where talking at a reasonable volume, with no music in the background. I will have to visit here more often, considering its a perfect location to my hotel and the prices are very cheap, even for a beer. The service was good, but i imagine that was due to it being a Tuesday night. I dare say weekends will be demonstrably different, but you should expect that everywhere you go.

8i23cNB_vvOcmZ65OcDeew.text: Good value for the money - I'll definitely be back. Located on Camden lock the pub is massive with a large patio directly on the canal. The service was very friendly and had the usual weather spoons menu and offers. The pub is a mix of Camden locals and tourists as it is just across the water from the lock market which makes for great people watching. My food came quickly and as I expected. Nothing fancy - just a solid chainpub in a good location.

f_KaW1R6_CXkyoIoEoJ3TQ.text: Love this place. Close to the Camden canal with a selection of outside and inside tables. Lovely clean environs and friendly staff.The menu offers a good selection of dishes. It can get busy but it's worth visiting.

I_ju9GFLRgfnvGzlSESsig.text: This bar/restaurant has a nice environment indoors as well as a large appealing patio area for the nice summer time weather. However my experience was just average. They do serve food here, but we just stopped by for after dinner drinks. The service was a bit slow at the bar. They do have a wide selection of Draft and bottle beers as well as full liquor bar. I ordered a bottled Becks but as soon as I took the first sip, realized it was only slightly cold. Definitely not nice cold like a beer should be. Didn't bother going up to the bar to switch it out. Overall it was fine to stop in for a quick beer but not the most amazing place I've ever been.

photos.caption: Photo of The Ice Wharf - London, United Kingdom

vWpF_UVhEZ7gzldhAFYdmA.text: You don't get welcome, no one is taking care of you and no one mentioned that you have to order at the bar. Waiters are useless, rude, clumsy: My friend got a whole bowl of sauce on herself! Food was so-so (industrial) run away.

viox_xIXnTI_sxxM1rhI6A.text: I have always heard about the Ice Wharf and for the first time I have been there. The music is fine and the place is crowded. You can enjoy a beer or a cocktail sat in a small place but without chatting because the music is so high or you can go dancing on the small dancefloor near the bar. Unfortunately I did not enjoy all night because there was a suspect device under the Camden bridge and we were evacuated. However I think I will go once again.

6t6ouXWlo5pYVuGhvVyZyQ.text: In a really great location as its right on the water opposite Camden Lock and has lovely views both day and night! It's a big place with lots of seating and lots of room for mingling! There was a great variety of choice on food. Drinks were very reasonably priced aswell- I bought a cocktail pitcher for £9! Result!

IYPHhcNuLsEZfjj58dnkFw.text: Amazing outdoor patio seating in the heart of Camdentown overlooking the canals.  It was an amazing meeting spot for a warm, sunny early September afternoon! Extraordinary large indoor Pub and restaurant. I enjoyed a couple of pints and the bar food looked good and reasonably priced. Will come back again.

Drgwu_-k5Zcxemtf9TXADw.text: A massive Wetherspoons right on Camden Lock. It doesn't smell like a Wetherspoons, which is nice.There is a great deal of beer and cider on offer, and they also sell a lot of craft beers and IPA's at a really good price!You can take your drink outside and sit by the canal, which on a hot day is just lovely. When I went there was a busker entertaining everyone.

snt1jpvcJ7PruFGu9D6sQQ.text: I come here occasionally because of where it's situated, on the lock, with a big outside seating area that makes it attractive during the summer months.The inside is OK- it's quite big and the crowd is rather mixed. Nonetheless this place is buzzing. You must, must bring ID and you may even get ID checked at the bar (we were)- as the bouncers and the staff are very vigilant for underage drinkers. The alcohol selection is vast and they serve your standard pub grub if you're in the mood for some stodge. Just a heads up- the toilet cubicle doors have a translucent pane over them which is slightly weird, not to mention off putting (for me anyway). The staff are quite friendly- the guy who served us messed up my order quoting me a different price than expected. Instead of making me pay more he let me pay the price he told me in the first place.  If you're into cocktails, however, I would give this place a miss. While they do indeed serve cocktails, most of them are only available in pitchers (for a decent price), I wouldn't expect any expert mixology here. The cocktails are standard gin and juice, slightly sickly and a bit of let down. It's fine if you're looking for something cheap but after having sampled a cocktail here I would've rather settled for a good old beer.

U1xRBtNg2jw9ovM-TQW0kw.text: Santae hooooooo!Great starting point for santacon and they dealt with the madness fantastically! Brilliant location and was surprised to find out that it was a wetherspoons as not at all naff (compared to the Leeds equivalents!)

nDZDYoL7Fh1X2pWd3wlG-Q.text: The food here was okay, nothing special, but they did have a very large menu to accommodate all types and tastes of people. The clientele is very mixed, and the atmosphere is very comfortable. The location is perfect, and the staff was very kind and helpful. I would recommend to any traveling family looking for an easy lunch/dinner for the whole family at the right price!

K3083VLS7cjQrB6NvxLTOg.text: What a nice spot in Camden! When it is warm outside and the sun is shining then you should come here and sit near the canal and have a drink.The pub inside is quite big but nothing special so I would really recommend coming here on a nice day to sit outside.It can take a while to get served at the bar and it seems that men are getting served quicker (don't ask me why, the bartenders were men too).Prices are reasonable and the clientele is mixed.

obhhDcBP1ir_NG1zlXhvUA.text: I do like this place. It is very convenient to the Holiday Inn at Camden Locks. It is much more pleasant early in the week before the crowds get too large and it turns into more of a club than a pub.They tend to run out of the Leffe Blond late in the week, which is a bummer. The staff is very friendly, helpful and work hard. The food menu provides a wide selection of pub food and more. They take American Express too! Huge outdoor seating area if you can get a seat. Very, very busy on weekends! Over 800 people can fit into this place and there is a line on Friday and Saturday.I did not find free wifi as someone else mentioned.

KYTzzb90t5yiFprRbD9PEQ.text: Pro - Good selection of beers for a great price in a large open setting with plenty of comfortable seating.  Friendly wait staff.Cons - The food was probably the worst I ate my entire trip to London / Paris.  On par with Denny's.  They had a Steak special on Tue night which was a steak, drink and dessert for like 12 pounds I think.  I passed on that got the chicken breast sandwhich.  Very dry and bland.  I think it would have been just as bad no matter what I got. Verdict - Come here for the DRINKS ONLY.
